title: HMD Fusion is on its way to India with its modular chops

text: HMD unveiled the Fusion smartphone with a modular design back in September, and last month it received a Venom Smart Outfit. Now, it's getting ready to land in India. The phone is being teased by Amazon, and so you'll be able to buy it from that retailer when it does arrive in India. The launch date is still a mystery, but since the teaser campaign has started, it really can't be long now. The HMD Fusion comes with a 6.56-inch 720x1612 LCD touchscreen with 90 Hz refresh rate, the Snapdragon 4 Gen 2 chipset at the helm, 4/6/8GB of RAM, 128/256GB of storage, a 108 MP rear camera with a 2 MP depth sensor next to it, a 50 MP selfie snapper, and a 5,000 mAh battery with support for 33W wired charging. It runs Android 14 and is promised to receive two major upgrades, so it will end its life on Android 16.
html:
HMD unveiled the Fusion smartphone with a modular design back in September, and last month it received a Venom Smart Outfit. Now, it's getting ready to land in India.

The phone is being teased by Amazon, and so you'll be able to buy it from that retailer when it does arrive in India. The launch date is still a mystery, but since the teaser campaign has started, it really can't be long now.

The HMD Fusion comes with a 6.56-inch 720x1612 LCD touchscreen with 90 Hz refresh rate, the Snapdragon 4 Gen 2 chipset at the helm, 4/6/8GB of RAM, 128/256GB of storage, a 108 MP rear camera with a 2 MP depth sensor next to it, a 50 MP selfie snapper, and a 5,000 mAh battery with support for 33W wired charging. It runs Android 14 and is promised to receive two major upgrades, so it will end its life on Android 16.
